name: Radisson Blu Hotel Champs Elysees, Paris

reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary in Paris!
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at the Radisson. Small hotel in a great location - it's nice and quiet & the staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed Bed & B/fast (de-lish!)

reviews.title: Nice - Unless you want to eat here
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel - but not worth the money. My partner and I stayed here for a weekend at the end of August 2005. The hotel itself is well maintained and has a good location. The major downside to this hotel is that if your stay includes a Saturday or Sunday, the kitchen is closed and you can not eat here. This is not what I expect from a hotel of this class.

reviews.title: Watch out
reviews.text: Overall, Paris is a lovely city, but I would not chose this hotel again. Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Watch out. The hotel is very nice and despite being on a busy road has good sound insulation. However you really do run the risk of being bumped. Just like another reviewer on this site I booked a two night stay over a month in advance abd was told, on arrival, that there were no room for me at the inn (a similar excuse of clients being ill etc). They put us in the napoleon for one night. The napoleon was ok but not up the Radisson's standards. Anyway our w/e was very much inconvenienced and I insisted on a discount, which I got and made up for it, at least to some extent - but I would have preferred to pay full rate and stay at the radisson.
A tip. Radisson have a policy - if you dont like what they give you and they dont correct it - you dont pay. I didn't insist on it (I did get a discount) but am sure that I could have.
reviews.title: Good hotel,central location

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in the SAS Radisson on the Avenue Marceau for 4 nights in early May for our 5th wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Attentive & Cute Boutique Hotel
Ravishing Radisson
reviews.text: Overall this is an excellent boutique hotel, it has a wonderful location very close to the Champs Elysees and Metro which makes it very easy to get around. The room was comfortable with a large bathroom and had a turn down service every night. The staff were attentive, polite and very pleasant at all times, we would return to this hotel without hesitation.

We made great use of the publicis shop on the corner of the Champs Elysees and their croissants were amasing, much better than paying a fortune for breakfast if it is not included in your package. There is also a restaurant in the publicis complex which was very good for dinner and we had ice-cream sundaes in there on our last afternoon which were very nice indeed!
reviews.title: Sorry... I was disappointed!

reviews.text: We can heartedly recommend trying a Segway tour of paris[-----] our guide PJ was excellent, very knowledgeable and fun unlike some stuffy guides who take themselves too seriously. It's a superb way to see paris without the strain of aching legs or having your nose constantly in a guide book!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel, Fabulous Location..

reviews.text: We also tried the bateux mouche and although it was quite good, we sat at the back of the boat which was very smelly with diesel fumes and i would advise that no matter the weather, you should take a cardigan or jacket as it can get pretty cold.
reviews.title: Magnificent hotel, brilliant location!

reviews.text: We booked a "room with a view package" for 280 euro to celebrate my husband's birthday. The room was absolutely gorgeous, with champagne and a view of the Arc de Triomphe and Eiffel Tower. Although we arrived well into the evening and had booked for dinner, the champagne and a bath in the divine bathroom seduced us first! Our request for a later table was happily accommodated. The staff at this hotel are amazing - all those we met were French and tolerated my attempts to practice their language, but spoke impeccable English when necessary. They were all friendly and helpful. Our dinner was lovely but although I'd told them in advance I'm a vegetarian, I was given the almost inevitable omelette! This was disappointing. I know the hotel's in Paris, but a quiche or something similar shouldn't have presented a challenge to a good chef! Our breakfast, included in the room price, made up for it.
reviews.title: Birthday bliss in Paris

reviews.text: We thought the package was fantastic value and can't wait to go back for a longer stay.
reviews.title: 100% Perfect!
Amazing staff & Stay
reviews.text: My mother and I stayed at this hotel in mid-August 2005 for four nights (I'm a little delayed in writing my review). The location is absolutely wonderful. When we traveled to Paris in the past we received somewhat of a frosty reception from our hotel, but the staff at the Radisson went above and beyond being friendly. They booked our train reservation to London for us, finding an incredible deal, gave us suggestions for many delicious restaurants on the Champs to try, and the concierge even had a drink with us one evening (after work of course). :)

reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect
reviews.text: The room was very posh and modern, with flat screen tvs and gorgeous furniture. Although it's a little smaller than traditional American hotel rooms, it never felt tiny. There's only about eight rooms per floor, which makes it feel even more quaint.

The location of the hotel is fantastic - the Champs is one street over. My mother and I never felt nervous walking home at night, even after a few glasses of wine on the Champs. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel that I would gladly return to.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Beautiful rooms
